Description: Glazed composition stirrup jar; modelled; flaring spout; top of false neck preserved but not handles; squat globular body with low ring base; brown-black paint on a blue-green glazed background; row of petals framed by double horizontal lines on shoulder; rosette on top of false neck; traces of floral design on shoulder; thick yellow core; extensively reconstructed.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: See also M. Cowell, 'Report on the examination of some Late Bronze Age faience vessels from Cyprus and Egypt' in: V. Karageorghis ed. Cyprus between the Orient and the Occident, Nicosia: Department of Antiquities (1986), 173-174.
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 232)
